alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou County from the Cascade Mountains East and South to Mt Shasta (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 18 at 1:52AM PDT until July 19 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND WITH LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 284... * Impacts: Strong, gusty wind with low relative humidity and critically dry vegetation will greatly increase the spread potential of any new and existing fires. * Affected area: In Northern CA...The northeast portion of FWZ 284, including Macdoel, Tennant, and Dorris. * Wind: Southwest 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * Humidity: 8 to 12 percent. * View the hazard area in detail at: https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD Precautionary/preparedness actions... A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible during the valid watch time. These conditions could promote the rapid spread of wildfires which could become life- threatening. Check weather.gov/medford for forecast updates and a possible upgrade of the this watch to a Red Flag Warning. &&

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou County from the Cascade Mountains East and South to Mt Shasta
